abstract: Consumers are unlikely to benefit from household versions of automated external defibrillators meant to revive victims of sudden heart seizures, a new study found.
snippet: Consumers are unlikely to benefit from household versions of automated external defibrillators meant to revive victims of sudden heart seizures, a new study found.
lead_paragraph: Consumers are unlikely to benefit from buying household versions of emergency equipment meant to revive victims of sudden heart seizures, according to long-awaited results from a clinical trial announced Tuesday.

headline.main: Study Finds Home Defibrillator Is No Help
headline.print_headline: Study Finds No Increase in Survival Rates With Home Defibrillators
